column4: is there a way to make ubuntu allow me to close processes during a lockup?
Try going to a tty with ctrl+alt+F1
i tried and it just gives me a bunch of strange coloured (what appears to be) ascii art.
Try booting without usplash and it may show correctly, for some reason with some hardware usplash corrupts video for ttys
You can also try sshing in from another machine
ahh sshing might work ... see i was in the middle of upgrading my dist and a program locked up the whole computer but its still installing just verry slowly
If it's slow because you are running out of memory then linux will eventually kill the process using the most RAM, but that won't happen until you run out of swap space

The desktop side of Linux is much less stable than the *NIX heart, ssh will almost never fail you ( unless you loose your network connection of course )

pgrep amsn to see if it's running ( it will output the process id ) then "pkill amsn" or "kill pid" to kill it

You can kill their gnome-session, be careful though because if you "log out" the user that is running update manager the upgrade will stop
